attribute.attributeDefinition: The unique code for each baseline program project funded through the SC MPA Baseline Program. This code refers to a specific entry on the SC_MPA_BaselineProgramInformation_LookupTable.
The site where the intertidal survey was conducted along the West Coast of North America. Each site name corresponds to a unique location.
Used to order the sites geographically along the coast. Actual values are arbitrary, and should not be used for site identification.
The number of degrees North of the equator, expressed in decimal degrees.
The number of degrees West of the Prime Meridian, expressed in decimal degrees.
Unique Long Term Monitoring survey lookup code that is referenced by the observation tables. If this field is blank, Long Term Monitoring surveys were not done at this site.
Unique Biodiversity survey lookup code that is referenced by the observation tables. If this field is blank, Biodiversity surveys were not done at this site.

The name of the MPA where the referenced site is located. If this field is blank, the referenced site is not located within an MPA. This name refers to a specific entry on the SC_MPA_BoundaryInformation_LookupTable.

textDomain.definition: Name of the MPA as identified by the California Department of Fish and Wildlife (CDFW) http://www.dfg.ca.gov/mlpa

attribute.attributeDefinition: Describes the type of California Marine Protected Area (MPA) that the site is located in, as defined by the California Department of Fish and Wildlife. If this field is blank, the referenced site is not located within an MPA, or is not a reference site for an existing MPA site.

codeDefinition.definition: State Marine Conservation Area. May limit recreational and/or commercial take to protect a specific resource or habitat.
State Marine Park. May allow recreational take, or limit it in some way, but does not allow commercial take.

State Marine Reserve. The most restrictive classification, these are no‐take areas (i.e. extractive activities are prohibited, and it is unlawful to injure, damage, take, or possess any living, geological, or cultural marine resource, except under a scientific collecting permit or authorized research, restoration, or monitoring).

State Marine Recreational Management Area. A non‐terrestrial marine or estuarine area designated so the managing agency may provide, limit, or restrict recreational opportunities to meet other than purely local needs while preserving basic resource values for present and future generations.
Special Closures have varying degrees of protection.

attribute.attributeDefinition: The name of the National Marine Sanctuary (NMS) where the referenced site is located. If this field is blank, the referenced site is not located within an NMS.

textDomain.definition: Name of the NMS region as identified by the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) http://sanctuaries.noaa.gov/welcome.html

attribute.attributeDefinition: The name of the Area of Special Biological Significance (ASBS) where the referenced site is located. If this field is blank, the referenced site is not located within an ASBS.

textDomain.definition: Name of the ASBS region as identified by the State Water Resources Control Board (SWRCB) http://www.swrcb.ca.gov
